criterior: waste_segregation_quality < -0.08 AND waste_segregation_quality > -0.15 AND contamination_risk_index > 0.05 AND contamination_risk_index < 0.25
risk_problems: Moderate segregation quality decline with manageable contamination. Often caused by unclear or missing signage. Quick, low-cost intervention can reverse trend before serious deterioration.
recommendation: Immediate action: Audit all waste station signage for clarity, visibility, and condition. Replace faded, damaged, or confusing signs. Add visual guides (pictures of items) not just text. Use consistent color coding. Ensure multilingual signage if needed. Add 'contamination examples' showing what NOT to include. Budget: ~$500-2000, Timeline: 1-2 weeks, Impact: 10-20% segregation improvement.

risk_problems: Declining recycling with increasing general waste. Often caused by inconvenient bin placement - people use whatever bin is closest. Simple relocation can significantly improve performance.
recommendation: Walk facility with staff to identify convenience gaps. Place recycling bins directly adjacent to general waste (paired placement). Add recycling bins in high-generation areas (break rooms, copy rooms, near vending). Remove general waste from areas where recyclables generated. Ensure adequate capacity. Budget: ~$1000-5000 for bins, Timeline: 1-3 weeks, Impact: 15-25% recycling increase.

risk_problems: Moderate performance decline across metrics. Often indicates staff turnover or knowledge gaps. Quick training intervention can restore performance. New staff may not know systems.
recommendation: Conduct 30-minute lunch-and-learn sessions across all shifts. Create 5-minute onboarding video on waste segregation. Send email refresher with photos of proper segregation. Post FAQ at each waste station. Assign department champions for peer training. Budget: ~$2000-5000 (staff time + materials), Timeline: 2-4 weeks, Impact: 15-30% improvement across metrics.

risk_problems: Moderate organic waste increase. Cafeteria/food service typically concentrated source - easy to pilot. High visibility location for demonstrating commitment. Quick win builds momentum for broader program.
recommendation: Install clearly labeled compost bins at cafeteria tray drop-off. Staff one monitor during initial launch week for guidance. Partner with composting facility for collection. Track diversion metrics and publicize. Add signage showing environmental impact. Budget: ~$3000-8000 (bins, collection, monitoring), Timeline: 4-6 weeks, Impact: 30-50% organic diversion from cafeteria.

risk_problems: Significant recyclable materials not captured, particularly if construction/warehouse operations. Cardboard baling can generate revenue and reduce collection frequency. Fast payback on equipment.
recommendation: Evaluate cardboard volume and baler ROI. Small balers cost $3-8K, pay back in 6-18 months through reduced collection and material revenue. Dedicate area for cardboard collection and baling. Train staff on baler operation. Negotiate direct sales to recyclers. Budget: ~$3000-10000, Timeline: 4-8 weeks, Impact: 20-40% recyclable recovery increase + revenue.

risk_problems: Moderate waste increase, likely includes reusable items being discarded. Office supplies, packaging, containers often reusable. Simple collection and redistribution system can reduce purchases and waste.
recommendation: Establish supply exchange area for reusable items (folders, binders, packaging materials, boxes). Send monthly 'available items' email. Create take-what-you-need shelf. Save moving boxes for next moves. Implement reusable dish/mug program in break rooms. Budget: ~$500-2000 (shelving, communication), Timeline: 2-3 weeks, Impact: 10-20% waste prevention.

risk_problems: General waste increasing, likely includes paper. Printing defaults to single-sided in most organizations. Changing default to duplex halves paper waste with zero behavior change required.
recommendation: IT department changes all printer defaults to duplex. Maintain single-side option for exceptions. Add print preview default to reduce unnecessary prints. Implement print quota awareness. Encourage digital document sharing. Budget: ~$0-500 (IT time), Timeline: 1 week, Impact: 30-50% paper waste reduction, immediate.

risk_problems: Construction/maintenance waste increasing with poor segregation. Maintenance areas often lack proper waste infrastructure. Quick infrastructure addition enables segregation. High-value materials (metal, wood) being mixed and landfilled.
recommendation: Install segregated bins in maintenance/workshop areas (metal, wood, general). Label clearly with examples. Train maintenance staff on segregation value. Partner with metal recycler for regular pickup. Budget: ~$2000-5000 (bins, training), Timeline: 2-3 weeks, Impact: 40-60% construction waste diversion.

risk_problems: E-waste accumulating. People often store old electronics (uncertainty about disposal). One-time collection event can clear backlog and establish system. Partner does heavy lifting.
recommendation: Organize quarterly or annual e-waste collection event with certified recycler. Promote widely to staff. Accept personal electronics to build goodwill. Provide data destruction certificates. Use event to educate on ongoing e-waste disposal options. Budget: ~$500-3000 (partner fee, promotion), Timeline: 4-6 weeks to organize, Impact: immediate e-waste clearance + ongoing system.

risk_problems: General waste increasing, recycling decreasing, contamination rising. Individual desk bins make recycling inconvenient and enable contamination. Removing them forces use of central segregation stations. Proven effective in many organizations.
recommendation: Remove individual desk bins, provide centralized segregation stations only. Offer small compost bin for food if needed. Communicate as waste reduction initiative. Monitor adoption and adjust station locations as needed. Budget: ~$0 (may sell/repurpose old bins), Timeline: 1-2 weeks, Impact: 15-30% improvement in segregation and recycling.

risk_problems: Moderate hazardous waste increase. Often caused by accumulation or undiscovered stockpiles. Quick audit can identify and properly dispose of backlog. Prevents escalation to crisis.
recommendation: Conduct one-day hazardous material sweep of facility. Check storage areas, closets, under sinks, labs, maintenance areas. Properly dispose of old/expired materials. Create manifest of current hazardous materials. Update SDS library. Budget: ~$2000-8000 (disposal + consultant if needed), Timeline: 1-2 weeks, Impact: immediate hazardous waste reduction + compliance improvement.

risk_problems: Moderate negative trends across multiple metrics. Lack of cross-functional coordination and sustained focus. Green team provides structure, accountability, and grassroots engagement. Quick to launch, high impact.
recommendation: Form cross-functional green team (operations, facilities, procurement, staff volunteers). Meet monthly. Charter to improve waste metrics and sustainability. Empower to make small changes without lengthy approvals. Report to leadership. Celebrate successes. Budget: ~$1000-3000 (meeting time, supplies), Timeline: 2 weeks to launch, Impact: 10-25% improvement across metrics over 3-6 months.

risk_problems: Large waste increase likely includes shipping/packaging materials. Procurement drives upstream waste. Simple policy requiring minimal packaging from suppliers can significantly reduce waste at source.
recommendation: Add packaging requirement to supplier contracts: minimal packaging, recyclable materials, takeback programs. Prioritize suppliers with sustainable packaging. Request bulk shipments vs individual. Eliminate Styrofoam/expanded polystyrene. Budget: ~$0 (policy change), Timeline: 1-2 weeks to implement policy, Impact: 15-30% packaging waste reduction over 3-6 months.

risk_problems: Rising contamination threatening recycling program. People unaware their mistakes. Quick feedback system builds awareness. Visual and timely feedback changes behavior. Low cost, high impact.
recommendation: Implement contamination tagging: attach rejection tags to contaminated bins explaining issue. Leave contaminated bins visible with signage. Photo documentation of good vs bad examples. Weekly contamination report to departments. Consider 'contamination report card'. Budget: ~$500-2000 (tags, photos, signage), Timeline: 1-2 weeks, Impact: 20-40% contamination reduction in 1-2 months.

risk_problems: Moderate performance decline. Awareness and communication gap. Informal 5-minute 'waste talks' at staff meetings raise awareness quickly. Water cooler conversations spread best practices. Low effort, builds culture.
recommendation: Add 5-minute waste topic to existing staff meetings. Share performance metrics, tips, success stories. Use visual props (contamination examples). Make it fun, not punitive. Encourage questions and suggestions. Rotate through departments. Budget: ~$500 (materials prep), Timeline: ongoing, start immediately, Impact: 10-20% improvement through increased awareness.

risk_problems: General waste increasing while recycling decreasing. Bin sizing can influence behavior. Small general bins + large recycling bins nudges proper sorting. Quick infrastructure change.
recommendation: Replace large general waste bins with small ones. Replace small recycling bins with large ones. Capacity constraints on general waste forces attention to segregation. Ensure adequate recycling capacity to avoid frustration. Budget: ~$3000-8000 (bin replacement), Timeline: 2-4 weeks, Impact: 20-35% shift from general to recycling.

risk_problems: Recycling declining but contamination manageable. Attempting too much at once often fails. Focus on single material (e.g., bottles, cans) for 1-2 months. Build success and momentum. High visibility, easy to measure.
recommendation: Choose one target material (bottles, cans, paper). Run focused 1-2 month campaign with goals, signage, tracking. Make it competitive between areas. Publicize results. Once successful, add next material. Budget: ~$2000-5000 (campaign materials, prizes), Timeline: 1 month campaign, Impact: 30-50% increase in target material recovery.

risk_problems: Significant organic waste including food from desks (snacks, lunches at desk). Central compost bins miss this stream. Simple desk-side collection can capture. Particularly effective in office environments.
recommendation: Provide small (1L) compost bins or bags for desk use. Central collection points for dumping. Compostable bags (if needed) or washable bins. Clear guidance on what's compostable. Budget: ~$5-15 per person, Timeline: 3-4 weeks, Impact: 20-40% increase in organic diversion from desk dining.

risk_problems: Serious contamination issues requiring immediate intervention. Temporary station attendants during peak times provide education and enforcement. Expensive but effective rapid intervention. Typically 2-4 week duration.
recommendation: Station attendants at key waste collection points during high-traffic times (lunch, breaks). Provide guidance on segregation. Monitor contamination. Friendly and educational, not punitive. Typically reduces contamination 50%+ during intervention. Budget: ~$5000-15000 (labor for 2-4 weeks), Timeline: immediate start possible, Impact: 40-60% contamination reduction, 20-30% sustained after removal.

risk_problems: Waste increasing, likely includes single-serve packaging. Bulk purchasing dramatically reduces packaging waste. Often cost-neutral or cost-saving. Quick procurement policy change.
recommendation: Identify bulk purchasing opportunities: beverages, snacks, supplies, cleaning products. Install dispensers as needed. Calculate packaging reduction and cost savings. Communicate benefits. Budget: ~$2000-8000 (dispensers, initial bulk products), Timeline: 4-6 weeks, Impact: 20-40% packaging waste reduction in targeted categories.

risk_problems: Paper waste increasing. Cultural default to print everything. Make digital the default for common documents. Printing requires active choice. Behavior change through system design.
recommendation: Implement digital document management system. Default to email/shared drives vs printing. Digital signatures for approvals. Paperless meeting policy (presentations on screens). Print on demand, not 'just in case'. Budget: ~$0-5000 (may leverage existing systems), Timeline: 2-4 weeks to implement policy, Impact: 30-50% paper waste reduction.

risk_problems: Hazardous waste scattered across facility. Consolidation improves compliance and reduces risk. Single collection point enables proper storage and scheduled pickup. Quick infrastructure improvement.
recommendation: Designate single secure hazardous waste collection point. Proper storage cabinet/area with secondary containment. Clear labeling and procedures. Scheduled regular pickup. Train all staff on location and use. Budget: ~$3000-10000 (storage cabinet, signage, training), Timeline: 3-4 weeks, Impact: immediate compliance improvement, 20-30% hazardous waste reduction through better management.

risk_problems: Disposable food container waste increasing. Cafeteria or food service operation. Reusable containers eliminate waste at source. Quick pilot with high visibility. Often cost-positive through reduced disposable purchases.
recommendation: Provide reusable plates, bowls, utensils in cafeteria. Dishwashing arrangement (on-site or service). Deposit system if needed. Eliminate or charge premium for disposables. Calculate disposables cost savings. Budget: ~$5000-20000 (containers, dishwashing setup), Timeline: 6-8 weeks, Impact: 50-80% food service disposable elimination.

risk_problems: Significant landscaping waste hauled away. On-site mulching eliminates hauling costs and provides valuable mulch for landscaping use. Quick ROI on chipper/mower if volume sufficient.
recommendation: Evaluate landscape waste volume and mulching equipment ROI. Chip woody waste on-site. Mulch-mow grass clippings. Use mulch in landscaping (free, no hauling). Consider small chipper ($2-5K) or mulching mowers ($500-2K). Budget: ~$2000-8000 (equipment), Timeline: immediate, Impact: 60-100% landscape waste diversion + cost savings + better landscaping.

risk_problems: Organic and combustible waste increasing. Waste-to-energy available but underutilized. Often knowledge gap about what's acceptable. Quick vendor partnership and education can optimize.
recommendation: Meet with waste-to-energy facility to understand acceptable materials. Train staff on energy recovery stream. Add energy recovery bins if needed. Optimize collection schedule. Calculate cost comparison vs landfill. Budget: ~$1000-3000 (bins, training), Timeline: 3-4 weeks, Impact: 30-50% increase in energy recovery, cost neutral or positive.
